content.question: Which of the following functions is an appropriate model for this situation?

choices.label: ​<math alttext="f open parentheses t close parentheses equals 2 sin open parentheses pi over 10 t close parentheses"><semantics><mrow><mi>f</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>sin</mi><mfenced><mrow><mfrac><mi>π</mi><mn>10</mn></mfrac><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfenced></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>

​<math alttext="f open parentheses t close parentheses equals 2 sin open parentheses pi over 3 t close parentheses"><semantics><mrow><mi>f</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>sin</mi><mfenced><mrow><mfrac><mi>π</mi><mn>3</mn></mfrac><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfenced></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>

​<math alttext="f open parentheses t close parentheses equals 2 sin open parentheses 6 t close parentheses"><semantics><mrow><mi>f</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>sin</mi><mfenced><mrow><mn>6</mn><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfenced></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>

​<math alttext="f open parentheses t close parentheses equals 2 sin open parentheses 12 pi t close parentheses"><semantics><mrow><mi>f</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>sin</mi><mfenced><mrow><mn>12</mn><mi>π</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfenced></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>

content.answer: ​<math alttext="f open parentheses t close parentheses equals 2 sin open parentheses 12 pi t close parentheses"><semantics><mrow><mi>f</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>sin</mi><mfenced><mrow><mn>12</mn><mi>π</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfenced></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>

topic.text: 3.7: Sinusoidal Function Context and Data Modeling

skill.text: Skill 1.C: Construct new functions, using transformations, compositions, inverses, or regressions, that may be useful in modeling contexts, criteria, or data, with and without technology.
